p: The MicroPerc equipment has a higher initial cost than a conventional ureteroscopy. Similar to other minimally invasive treatments, the initial cost must be offset by reducing the cost of operating room use, hospitalization, and complications. Furthermore, in our case, the minimum requirement of auxiliary procedures (transient nephrostomy or JJ ureteral stenting) reduced the total cost of the procedure. We think that we will also have less associated morbidity ( 2, 6).
